Tip.TipText: When commenting your files being used by your ATL Server, don't put tags in comments unless you mean to, as they will be processed by the associated ATL Server handler
You can use the include tag to piece together a Server Response File just like you can do with the #include directive and Active Server pages.
Files included by using the include tag do not have to be files of .SRF extension. The include can be another ATLServer DLL, HTML file, TXT file, or SRF File for examples.
Found in the Edit | Outlining menu, allows you to collapse blocks of code in your source files for easier reading.
You can build up common windows into a tabbed view to save on space and to make each tab seem larger height wise.
In Tools | Options | HTML Designer you can change the default mode to HTML View so you can get right to your editing work.
